name: @thej@social.thej.in
note: Hacker, Maker, Blogger, Developer, Teacher, Public Interest Technologist @DataMeet & CTO @Peppo. I blog at ThejeshGN.com and this is my social microblog. Everything is Personal. Bangalore/India. +05:30, IST. He/His. Email.

content.html: Internet Toot Radio presents Geek of the Week. https://archive.org/details/RTFM-Geek-931027 Carl Malamud interviews Tim Berners-Lee, developer of the World Wide Web, one of the most innovative and exciting applications to be deployed on the Internet. First airing was October 27, 1993. On @internetarchive at https://archive.org/details/RTFM-Geek-931027 I was skeptical of the whole idea at the time, was not running a "web" server myself, but I came around to the whole idea.

content.html:
Recent #microblogpub updates:

  • New task to import follows from Mastodon export
  • New option to hide shares/announces from a specific actor
  • As usual, small fixes and tweaks
  • Improved OAuth 2.0 support
  • Improved ActivityPub C2S (client to server) support (more on that later!)
  • New YunoHost update available

Happy holidays! üéÖ

content.html:
Weekly Notes 51/2022

We are in Thrissur. It took us eight hours to reach Thrissur from Bangalore, which is a bit faster than last year or so. Primarily due to the¬†Kuthiran tunnel. The tolls have also increased quite a bit. I will have a page to track it.

https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/23/weekly-notes-51-2022/

content.html:
ByteDance used TikTok to track my location ‚Äî and the locations of two of my colleagues ‚Äî to try to find our sources. We reported on this back in October, but kept things vague to protect sources. Today ByteDance admitted it, so we can say much more:

https://www.forbes.com/sites/emilybaker-white/2022/12/22/tiktok-tracks-forbes-journalists-bytedance/
content.value: ByteDance used TikTok to track my location ‚Äî and the locations of two of my colleagues ‚Äî to try to find our sources. We reported on this back in October, but kept things vague to protect sources. Today ByteDance admitted it, so we can say much more:https://www.forbes.com/sites/emilybaker-white/2022/12/22/tiktok-tracks-forbes-journalists-bytedance/

content.html:
Kerala HC on right to publish: "We have already overruled the right to claim privacy in the public sphere in an Open Court system. The Courtroom is open to all. The Court cannot gloss over the protection available to publishers of judgments under Article 19(1)(a). Reporting and publishing of Judgments are part of
freedom of speech and expression and that cannot be taken away lightly without the aid of law"
content.value: Kerala HC on right to publish: "We have already overruled the right to claim privacy in the public sphere in an Open Court system. The Courtroom is open to all. The Court cannot gloss over the protection available to publishers of judgments under Article 19(1)(a). Reporting and publishing of Judgments are part of freedom of speech and expression and that cannot be taken away lightly without the aid of law"

content.html:
Kerala HC affirms Rajagopal‚Äôs case:"the Apex Court held that publication based on that public records cannot be objected to on the ground of the right to privacy. The judicial function is a public function and the records are treated as public records."

"Every litigant approaches the Court knowing fully well that the details of the case and the details of the party would form part of the public records."
content.value: Kerala HC affirms Rajagopal‚Äôs case:"the Apex Court held that publication based on that public records cannot be objected to on the ground of the right to privacy. The judicial function is a public function and the records are treated as public records."  "Every litigant approaches the Court knowing fully well that the details of the case and the details of the party would form part of the public records."

content.html:
Hi, ‚Äòverse! It is time for an #introduction.

I am Tomo, and I am a cartographer. I explore uncharted areas, bring a sense of #data, and create immersive #maps. I have extensive data analytics and wrangling experience, supported by in-depth #gis knowledge and broad geospatial background.

Only a few people from my old network moved away, so I am now looking for a fresh start. So far, hachyderm feels lovely and welcoming. Thank you, @nova!
content.value: Hi, ‚Äòverse! It is time for an #introduction. I am Tomo, and I am a cartographer. I explore uncharted areas, bring a sense of #data, and create immersive #maps. I have extensive data analytics and wrangling experience, supported by in-depth #gis knowledge and broad geospatial background. Only a few people from my old network moved away, so I am now looking for a fresh start. So far, hachyderm feels lovely and welcoming. Thank you, @nova!

content.html:
I spent a good part of this year investigating Google's ad business. Today we published a story about trying to crack open its black box ad network.

Unlike its competitors, Google conceals nearly all publishers it works with and where billions of ad dollars flow. We found that Google's vast ad network contains manga piracy, porn, fraud and disinformation.

Give it a read: https://www.propublica.org/article/google-display-ads-piracy-porn-fraud
content.value: I spent a good part of this year investigating Google's ad business. Today we published a story about trying to crack open its black box ad network.Unlike its competitors, Google conceals nearly all publishers it works with and where billions of ad dollars flow. We found that Google's vast ad network contains manga piracy, porn, fraud and disinformation.Give it a read: https://www.propublica.org/article/google-display-ads-piracy-porn-fraud

content.html:
My Boring Yet Modern Data Stack

We have a data stack that we have been using for years now. We have used it with medium to large customers, and they have worked very well. The goal has always been simple, stable, composable tools that can be used on the developer's machine and scaled to work with massive data on production. You can self-host them, host them on the cloud, or get managed services based on your need.

Very similar to my web stack. It's called "Boring" not because it's dull but because there are minimal unwanted surprises. So my current stack for data looks like this. This stack is both "Modern" and "Boring."

https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/22/my-boring-yet-modern-data-stack/

Missing

Currently, our documentation is basic and manual. I would want a sound metadata management and cataloging/discovery system‚Äîsystems like OpenDataDiscovery or OpenMetaData. But everything seems complex. Essentially I want a Metabase equivalent for metadata management and data discovery. I am still evaluating. I will update you if I find a good candidate. Please send me your suggestions.
content.value:
My Boring Yet Modern Data Stack
We have a data stack that we have been using for years now. We have used it with medium to large customers, and they have worked very well. The goal has always been simple, stable, composable tools that can be used on the developer's machine and scaled to work with massive data on production. You can self-host them, host them on the cloud, or get managed services based on your need.
Very similar to my web stack. It's called "Boring" not because it's dull but because there are minimal unwanted surprises. So my current stack for data looks like this. This stack is both "Modern" and "Boring."
https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/22/my-boring-yet-modern-data-stack/
Missing
Currently, our documentation is basic and manual. I would want a sound metadata management and cataloging/discovery system‚Äîsystems like OpenDataDiscovery or OpenMetaData. But everything seems complex. Essentially I want a Metabase equivalent for metadata management and data discovery. I am still evaluating. I will update you if I find a good candidate. Please send me your suggestions.

content.html:
‚ÄúIt was later revealed by India‚Äôs national auditor that, between 2006 and 2009, the Gujarat government sold natural gas to Adani at below-market rates. According to a 2013 report in the Economic Times, several senior Gujarat government officers had been given jobs at Adani following their retirement from public service.‚Äù

The rich always become richer with handouts. This is why they fight hard to prevent poor people from getting a handout.

content.html:
You might see fail whales on #fedi today. Have patience. It will improve.

Small improvements by crowd over time will make software better. Its been proven more than once. And probably it's the best way to develop social networking tools.

You might see fail whales on #fedi today. Have patience. It will improve.

content.html: Today‚Äôs social media status quo isn‚Äôt cutting it, so Mozilla is exploring an alternative here on Mastodon. In early 2023, Mozilla will be testing a publicly accessible instance in the Fediverse at Mozilla.Social. We will keep you updated, but for now learn more here: https://mzl.la/3BNXQMQ
content.value: Today‚Äôs social media status quo isn‚Äôt cutting it, so Mozilla is exploring an alternative here on Mastodon. In early 2023, Mozilla will be testing a publicly accessible instance in the Fediverse at Mozilla.Social. We will keep you updated, but for now learn more here:  https://mzl.la/3BNXQMQ

content.html:
@mozilla Love this sentence in the last paragraph, sums up the problem statement well IMHO -

"In private hands our [social media] choice is limited, toxicity is rewarded, rage is called engagement, public trust is corroded, and basic human decency is often an afterthought."
content.value: @mozilla Love this sentence in the last paragraph, sums up the problem statement well IMHO -"In private hands our [social media] choice is limited, toxicity is rewarded, rage is called engagement, public trust is corroded, and basic human decency is often an afterthought."
